title: Designing for Delight: Mastering UI/UX in the Digital Age
description: In today's fast-paced digital world, creating visually appealing designs is no longer enough - users expect intuitive, seamless, and delightful experiences. This event explores how thoughtful user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) design can elevate products.
whatToExpect: Keynote talks by experienced UI/UX professionals
Hands-on design challenges and live critiques
Tips on designing for accessibility, responsiveness, and engagement
speakerInfo: Ava Lim is a seasoned UX strategist and award-winning product designer with over 10 years of experience crafting intuitive digital experiences for global tech start-ups.

title: The Future of Fintech: Blockchain & Beyond
description: An in-depth look at how blockchain technology is disrupting traditional finance. We will cover cryptocurrencies, smart contracts, and the future of decentralized finance (DeFi) in Southeast Asia.
whatToExpect: Case studies of successful Malaysian Fintech startups
speakerInfo: Johan Razak, CTO of LedgerMy, is a blockchain enthusiast and former banking consultant who specializes in secure digital transactions.

title: Start-Up 101: From Idea to IPO
description: Do you have a million-dollar idea? This workshop guides students through the rigorous process of validating an idea, building a MVP, and pitching to investors.
whatToExpect: Pitch deck reviews by angel investors
speakerInfo: Sarah Chen, Founder of GreenEats, has successfully raised Series B funding and mentors young entrepreneurs across Asia.

title: Mental Health Matters: Managing Exam Stress
description: A crucial seminar for students facing academic pressure. Learn coping mechanisms, breathing techniques, and how to maintain a healthy work-life balance during finals week.
speakerInfo: Dr. Amirah Syafiqah is a clinical psychologist specializing in adolescent mental health and stress management.

title: Code & Coffee: Python for Beginners
description: A relaxed, beginner-friendly coding session. Bring your laptop and learn the basics of Python automation while enjoying free premium coffee.
speakerInfo: Tan Wei Ming, a Senior Software Engineer at Grab, loves teaching coding fundamentals to non-CS students.

title: Sustainable Living: Zero Waste Campus
description: Join the green revolution! Learn practical steps to reduce your carbon footprint and help transition our university into a zero-waste campus.
speakerInfo: Elena Gomez is an environmental scientist and activist who has led sustainability projects for NGOs worldwide.

title: AI in Healthcare: Saving Lives with Data
description: Discover how Artificial Intelligence is revolutionizing diagnostics, treatment plans, and patient care. Ideal for med-school and CS students alike.
whatToExpect: Panel discussion with doctors and data scientists
speakerInfo: Dr. K. Arumugam is a surgeon and AI researcher focusing on machine learning applications in oncology.

title: Photography Walk: Capturing Campus Life
description: Grab your camera or phone and join us for a guided photography walk. Learn about composition, lighting, and storytelling through lenses.
whatToExpect: Tips on editing with Lightroom Mobile
speakerInfo: Rizal Hisham is a freelance photojournalist whose work has been featured in National Geographic Asia.

title: Career Fair 2025: Connect & Hire
description: The biggest networking event of the year. Meet recruiters from top Fortune 500 companies and local unicorns looking for fresh graduates.
speakerInfo: Various HR Directors from Top Companies.

title: Mastering Public Speaking
description: Conquer your fear of the stage. This workshop focuses on body language, vocal projection, and structuring compelling speeches.
speakerInfo: Nancy Lee is a certified Toastmaster and communication coach who helps executives refine their presentation skills.

title: Cybersecurity: Hacking 101 (Ethical)
description: Understand the mindset of a hacker to better defend systems. This controlled environment workshop covers basic penetration testing and defense.
speakerInfo: Jason 'ZeroCool' Teoh is a certified ethical hacker and security consultant for banking institutions.

title: Digital Marketing for Beginners
description: Learn how to build a brand online. We cover SEO, social media marketing, and content creation strategies that actually convert.
speakerInfo: Fatima Zahra is a digital marketing lead who helped scale three e-commerce brands to 7-figure revenues.

title: Robotics Showcase: The Next Gen
description: Witness the latest innovations from the engineering faculty. From autonomous drones to bipedal robots, see what the future holds.
speakerInfo: Prof. Dr. H. Yamamoto is a leading researcher in robotics and automation systems.

title: Varsity E-Sports Championship Finals
description: Cheer for your faculty team as they battle it out in Dota 2 and Valorant. Big screens, loud cheers, and intense gameplay.
speakerInfo: Hosted by 'Shoutcaster' Mike.

title: Introduction to 3D Printing
description: Turn digital models into physical objects. Learn the basics of slicing software and printer maintenance.
speakerInfo: Kenji Ito is a product design student and lab assistant at the university Maker Space.

title: Creative Writing Workshop
description: Unleash your inner author. This session explores narrative structures, character development, and overcoming writer's block.
speakerInfo: Lina Ramli is a published novelist and columnist for a leading daily newspaper.

title: Investment 101: Stocks & Bonds
description: Stop saving, start investing. Learn the fundamentals of the stock market, risk management, and how to read financial statements.
speakerInfo: Mr. Chan, a certified financial analyst (CFA) with 20 years of market experience.

title: Yoga for Beginners
description: A rejuvenating session to stretch your body and calm your mind. Suitable for all fitness levels.
speakerInfo: Priya Singh is a certified Yoga alliance instructor.

title: Data Science: The Sexiest Job of the 21st Century
description: What exactly do data scientists do? We deconstruct the hype and look at real-world applications of Big Data.
speakerInfo: Dr. Farhan is a lecturer in Data Science and consultant for retail analytics.

title: Film Screening: 'The Last Borneo'
description: A documentary screening followed by a discussion on conservation efforts in East Malaysia.
speakerInfo: Director Mark Lee, an independent filmmaker focusing on environmental issues.

title: Valentine's Baking Workshop
description: Learn to bake cupcakes and cookies for your loved ones (or yourself!). All ingredients provided.
speakerInfo: Chef Rose is a pastry instructor known for her intricate cake designs.

title: Love & Relationships Panel
description: An open forum discussing modern relationships, communication standards, and red flags.
speakerInfo: Moderated by the University Counseling Unit.

title: Single & Mingling Mixer
description: A fun, low-pressure social event for students to meet new friends from different faculties.
speakerInfo: Hosted by the Student Council Social Committee.

title: Augmented Reality (AR) Workshop
description: Create your first AR filter for Instagram and TikTok using Spark AR Studio.
speakerInfo: Jenny Ko is a freelance AR creator with over 50 million impressions on her filters.

title: Resume Rescue Clinic
description: Is your resume getting rejected? Bring a printed copy and get 1-on-1 feedback to make it ATS-friendly and impactful.
speakerInfo: Career Counselors from the University Placement Office.

title: Debate Club Showcase
description: Watch the university's best debaters tackle the motion: 'This House Believes AI will do more harm than good'.
speakerInfo: Featuring the National Varsities Debate Champions.

title: Effective Leadership Seminar
description: Leadership isn't just about giving orders. Learn empathy, delegation, and strategic vision.
speakerInfo: Datuk Azman, CEO of Synergy Corp and alumni of the university.

title: Introduction to Astronomy
description: Explore the cosmos. We will be setting up telescopes to view Saturn's rings and the Moon's craters.
speakerInfo: Astronomy Club President and Physics Dept Lecturers.

title: Music Production: Making Beats
description: Learn the basics of FL Studio and Logic Pro. How to mix, master, and produce a track from your bedroom.
speakerInfo: DJ Zack represents the new wave of local electronic music producers.

title: Foreign Language Taster: Japanese
description: Konnichiwa! A fun introduction to the Japanese language and culture. Learn basic greetings and writing hiragana.
speakerInfo: Sensei Yumi, a native Japanese instructor with 15 years teaching experience.

title: Foreign Language Taster: French
description: Bonjour! Dip your toes into the language of love. We cover pronunciation and basic travel phrases.
speakerInfo: Madam Sophie, a fluent French speaker and linguistics expert.

title: Volunteer Briefing: Animal Shelter
description: We are organizing a visit to the local animal shelter. Attend this briefing to learn safety protocols and how you can help.
speakerInfo: Community Service Society Committee.

title: Chess Tournament
description: A rapid chess tournament for all skill levels. Prizes for the top 3 players.
speakerInfo: Organized by the University Chess Club.

title: Excel for Internships
description: Don't go into your internship unprepared. Master VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, and Macros to impress your boss.
speakerInfo: Mr. Lim is a corporate trainer specializing in productivity software.

title: DIY PC Building Workshop
description: Learn how to select parts and assemble your own custom gaming or workstation PC safely.
speakerInfo: Tech Club Committee Members.

title: Calligraphy & Hand Lettering
description: The art of beautiful writing. A relaxing workshop teaching brush pen calligraphy.
speakerInfo: Anna Arts, a freelance illustrator and calligrapher.

title: Understanding Tax in Malaysia
description: Adulting is hard. We explain LHDN, e-Filing, and tax reliefs so you don't get in trouble with the government later.
whatToExpect: How to register a tax file
speakerInfo: Representative from the Inland Revenue Board (LHDN).

title: Intro to Game Development with Unity
description: Ever wanted to build your own video game? Start here with the Unity engine.
speakerInfo: Alex Tan, Indie Game Developer with titles on Steam.

title: Mobile App Dev: Flutter vs React Native
description: A technical showdown. Which framework should you learn in 2026? We compare performance and developer experience.
speakerInfo: Senior Mobile Engineers from Grab and Shopee.

title: Badminton Friendly Match
description: Join us for a casual badminton session. Rackets and shuttles provided.
speakerInfo: Badminton Club Committee.

title: Psychology of Color in Marketing
description: Why is Facebook blue and McDonald's red? Learn how color influences consumer behavior.
speakerInfo: Dr. M. Harris, Lecturer in Consumer Psychology.

title: First Aid & CPR Certification
description: Learn life-saving skills. This is a condensed workshop covering the essentials of emergency response.
speakerInfo: Certified Trainers from St. John Ambulance.

title: Speed Networking for Introverts
description: Networking doesn't have to be scary. Structured, short interactions to help you build connections without the awkwardness.
speakerInfo: Facilitated by the Career Development Team.

title: IoT: Building Smart Home Devices
description: Introduction to Internet of Things using Arduino and Raspberry Pi.
speakerInfo: Tech Club Engineering Lead.

title: Futsal Tournament Qualifiers
description: The road to the championship starts here. 5-a-side matches.
speakerInfo: Sports Department Officers.

title: Contemporary Dance Workshop
description: Express yourself through movement. No prior dance experience required.
speakerInfo: Sarah J., lead choreographer of the University Dance Crew.

title: Thesis Writing Bootcamp
description: For final year students. We shut the doors and write. Mentors available for consultation.
speakerInfo: Academic Writing Support Staff.

title: Intro to Cloud Computing (AWS)
description: Why move to the cloud? Learn the basics of Amazon Web Services.
speakerInfo: Certified AWS Cloud Practitioner.

title: Table Tennis Championship
description: Fast-paced ping pong action. Who will be the university champion?
speakerInfo: Table Tennis Club.

title: End of Semester Music Night
description: Celebrate the end of exams with live performances by student bands and acoustic acts.
speakerInfo: Various Student Artists.

title: Introduction to Python for Data Science
description: A hands-on workshop designed for beginners to learn the basics of Python programming with a focus on data analysis libraries like Pandas and NumPy.
speakerInfo: Dr. Aiman Razak, Senior Lecturer at the Faculty of Computing.

title: Public Speaking Mastery: Voice & Confidence
description: Unlock your potential as a speaker by learning techniques to project your voice, manage stage fright, and structure compelling speeches.
speakerInfo: Ms. Sarah Lee, Toastmasters District Champion and Communication Coach.

title: Sustainable Engineering: Building for the Future
description: An insightful seminar exploring green building materials, renewable energy integration, and the future of eco-friendly infrastructure.
whatToExpect: Q&A session on career paths in sustainability
speakerInfo: Ir. Tan Wei Ming, Green Building Index (GBI) Facilitator.

title: Financial Literacy 101 for Students
description: Learn how to manage your student budget, understanding loans, and basic investment strategies to secure your financial future early.
whatToExpect: Tips on saving money as a student
speakerInfo: Mr. Johan Ariff, Certified Financial Planner (CFP).

title: Adobe Illustrator Workshop: Logo Design
description: Dive into the world of vector graphics and learn how to create professional logos and branding materials using Adobe Illustrator.
venue: Multimedia Studio, Faculty of Creative Arts
speakerInfo: Emily Wong, Freelance Graphic Designer and Alumni.
